snippet: Vietnam veterans are suing the armed forces, arguing that they had PTSD when they were given other-than-honorable discharges.
abstract: Editorial supports lawsuit filed by Vietnam veterans, who are seeking to retroactively upgrade their discharges,  that claims the military unfairly refused to consider their PTSD diagnoses when issuing discharge; notes many veterans received other-than-honorable discharges, losing benefits, due to a condition that was not recognized until 1980.
lead_paragraph: Vietnam veterans are suing the armed forces, arguing that they had PTSD when they were given other-than-honorable discharges.

headline.seo: A Question of Honor, Fairness and PTSD
headline.main: A Question of Honor, Fairness and PTSD
headline.print_headline: A Question of Honor, Fairness and PTSD

keywords.value: United States Defense and Military Forces
